context.p: To configure a bridge on Ubuntu 10.04 LTS (Lucid) or 12.04 LTS (Precise):

step.cmd: Modify the /etc/network/interfaces file to match one of the following examples. If you have more than one ethernet device, br0 can be associated with the device of your choice. Replace lines associated with that device as in these examples. You do not need to remove or modify lines associated with other devices.

choices.choice:
If you are using DHCP, the configuration will look similar to the following example: auto lo iface lo inet loopback
auto br0 iface br0 inet dhcp bridge_ports eth0

If you are using a static IP address, the configuration will look similar to the following example: auto lo iface lo inet loopback
auto br0 iface br0 inet static address <static_IP_address> network <network> netmask <netmask> broadcast <broadcast_IP_address> gateway <gateway> bridge_ports eth0 bridge_stp off
